Technique: FORMED BY HAND; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Figurine of bewitchment
Description: This figurine of bewitchment modelled in raw clay, depicts a kneeling captive, the elbows tied behind the back. It bears a text in very cursive hieratic painted in red. This example is part of a large collection of similar figurines found in the necropolis of Saqqara. The objects served to obtain a certain magical power over enemies of all types.
